required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Long Term Efficacy of Endovascular Treatment of Type 2 Endoleaks
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Long Term Efficacy of Endovascular Treatment of Type 2 Endoleaks

brief_summary.textblock: Endovascular treatment has become the first choice to repair abdominal aortic aneurym, but exposes patients to a risk of endoleaks. Although treatment of type 1 and 3 endoleaks has proven to prevent aneurysms from rupture, controversies remain about type 2 endoleaks. The investigators described the different techniques of type 2 endovascular repair, and their efficacy at short and long term..

primary_outcome.measure: Recurrence rate of type II endoleaks treated with endovascular intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Type of type II endoleaks treatment

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients treated for type II endoleaks
arm_group.description: Patients treated for type II endoleaks between the 01 January 2008 and the 31 March 2018 in the Cardiovascular and Thoracic Surgery Unit of Dijon Burgundy University Hospital

intervention.arm_group_label: Patients treated for type II endoleaks

study_pop.textblock: All patients treated for type II endoleaks by endovascular therapy between the 01 January 2008 and the 31 December 2018

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients treated for type II endoleaks by endovascular therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

overall_official.affiliation: Cardiovascular and Thoracic Surgery Unit - Dijon Univeristy Hospital

facility.name: Cardiovascular and thoracic surgery unit, CHU Dijon

patient_data.ipd_description: All patients signed a institutional form prior to the procedure stating that they did not object to the use of their medical data for research purposes. Before inclusion, all patients (or a trusted person) were informed about the study and its objectives. No opposition was expressed.
